title: Energy Transfer and Conservation

vocab.definition: The ability to cause change or do work
Stored energy that has the potential to cause motion
When energy moves from one object to another
When energy changes from one form to another (conversion)
Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only changed from one form to another
Energy related to heat and the motion of particles
Energy carried by moving electric charges
Heat transfer by direct contact between objects
Heat transfer by movement of liquids or gases
Heat transfer by waves, like sunlight
A force that resists motion and turns motion into heat
A system where no energy enters or leaves

teachingNotes: Use hands-on demonstrations with pendulums, rolling balls, and rubber bands to show energy transfer. Discuss how energy changes form but is never lost.
